headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: New Year's Eve Live. Aired 12-1a ET

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I got to say, that 20 minutes, from 10 to midnight to 10 minutes after --

utterances.speaker: ANDY COHEN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: It is amazing. It is beautiful.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: -- is the most incredible 20 minutes around.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It was so beautiful.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Amazing.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I feel like I'm in a state of namaste, 2023. It feels good here.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: A state of namaste.It is a little smoky here.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: There was a moment when confetti is everywhere --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It was all coming down.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It was really cool.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It was very exciting. That was almost spiritual.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: And to do it sober.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I know, a revelation.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: The clarity. Wow.Bryan Cox from "Succession," "Logan Roy" himself --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I'm so excited. COHEN

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And at 12

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And happy New Year, everybody.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We are 12 minutes into New Year.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: 2023. I hope it is everybody out there is listening, I hope it is your best year yet.Joining us now is the star of HBO's "Succession" and "The Independent," streaming on Peacock, Brian Cox. It is so wonderful to have you here.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN COX, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Thank you. This, wondering what I was doing for the last three hours, this is it.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: This is what you were doing.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Was this full when you began?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: It was full when I began but my wife was here so she helped. The last dribble is for you guys.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you, thank you.You know what? I appreciate it. So have you ever been in Times Square?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I have but as a member of the public rather than in this position. I have to say it was a surprisingly moving experience.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It is. It is quite moving, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Yes. I didn't expect it.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I think -- I think the great thing about Americans is you know how to do Christmas.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: And you half know how to do New Year but we Scots, we invented New Year's.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: What does that mean?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: We had, believe it or not, for 400 years, we weren't allowed to practice Christmas. It wasn't allowed. I mean it wasn't official. But because it was a papist thing, they didn't want that.So what happened was the New Year festivity became more popular and, therefore, we all became more egalitarian because we all joined in. So the whole thing about New Year and what we call the last night, it is called Hogmanay. That's the last night. And what you are supposed to do, you have to be dark, blue-eyed and you bear a piece of coal and go into someone's house and you wish them -- this is what should be starting now -- the good, the best for the year, the warmth of the year. You can do it with whiskey, you can do it with bread. The tradition is to do it with coal.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Does "Auld Lang Syne" ring in a special way for you?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Burns to me is the greatest poet of all time.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Here it is.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: "Should auld acquaintance be forgot -- "

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: "And never brought to mind?"

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: "Should auld acquaintance be forgot for the sake of auld lang syne?"For auld lang syne, my friends, for auld lang syne, we'll tak' a cup o' kindness yet, for the sake of auld lang syne."

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, I love that.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Sorry if I --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I have to have a toast now.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I had a Scottish nanny who told you about, who was really like my mom growing up.What?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Relatable.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm sorry, but OK.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: A huge influence.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: She was a huge influence on me.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: You can't do better than a Scottish nanny.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: She called me a skinny malink so I call my son all the time a skinny malink.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: "Skinny Malinky long legs, umbrella feet, "Went to the circus, couldn't get a seat."When the circus started, Skinny Malinky farted "When the circus ended, Skinny Malinky fell." (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You live in New York.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh really?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: How long have you lived in New York?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I have lived here since -- oh, God, 2008.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You are about to go back to Broadway, right?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Next -- not for a while.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Not for a while?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Hopefully 2024.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I'm very busy this year. I have a lot of things on my plate.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Well, you are busy.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We have to talk about "Succession."

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: The new season starts when?Can you say? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: We're still shooting it, yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You are still shooting it.Yes, you have been watching the show a little bit tonight. Knowing what you know about young Anderson and me, who do you think would be better equipped to run Waystar Royco?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Of you two?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It is an impossible choice.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Well, based on tonight's performance.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I would say none of you.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Right, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I had a feeling.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: On certain days I would have said Anderson probably.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you like Logan Roy?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You do?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I actually do.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I kind of like him, too.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Well, I have a lot of sympathy for him. He is a miserable bastard, he is a misanthrope, he is deeply unhappy. And he has three of the horriblest children -- or four. Actually, the oldest isn't too bad but the rest of them are pretty horrible. So I feel for him.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It seems this season it will be the kids going after him in a significant way.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Yes, they probably will.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: They probably will?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: They probably will.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I feel like he's so ready for it. I'm so excited for this season.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Oh, no, he will be fine. He's fine. He will deal with it pretty well.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You know what I love about him and I love about you?Neither of you have any Fs left to give.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: No, no Fs.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You really don't.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: No, I'm F'ed out.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: And you came out with a book -- that we talked about on radio, Andy -- that you called Johnny Depp overrated, Steven Seagal ludicrous. Bowie not a particularly good actor, Edward Norton a pain in the ass, Quentin Tarantino's work meretricious.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: This is deeply embarrassing.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Did you hear from anyone in the book?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Only one and I can't say who the person was. But he was only mentioned in passing and he was deeply upset.I wrote him back and said, "I never meant to upset you. Other people I meant to upset but you are not one of them."

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You're right. And you only mentioned that person in passing?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Only in passing.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I ran into Steven Seagal once in New Orleans during Hurricane Katrina and he was dressed in a police uniform, driving a police car. I was doing a live shot. He came out and I turned.I was like, "Steven Seagal dressed as a police man. "What are you doing here?" And he said, "I'm not even here, man, I'm just doing the work," and got back in the police car and left.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: He's a funny fellow.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: And that's where the work began.(CROSSTALK) COX:  Exactly, exactly.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Aren't we all just doing the work really?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: --  we are just doing the work, man.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: We are following our -- we are adroitly following our mercenary (ph) calling and drawing our wages. That's what we're doing.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, we are.I'm so glad. It was so nice, you kind of glided in here after midnight. And he and I were in this state of kind of --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: -- transcendentalism.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: No, no, I'm fairly transcendental at the best of times. My New Year's resolution is to make no resolutions whatsoever. That's my New Year's resolution.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You don't seem like a New Year's resolution guy.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: No, I don't believe in all that.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What do you love about New York?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I used to love New York even more than I do now.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes?

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I like the -- I love yin and the yang of New York. And I miss a little bit of the yin. That's why I live in Brooklyn. Brooklyn's the place, people. I really love Brooklyn. So we have great time there.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You know what is so incredible?You can hear now the sounds of the cleanup crew.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I mean, you know, it happens almost immediately.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I promised my wife I would say one thing on behalf of the New Year.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: OK. COXThis is a year that we've watched the women in Iran be treated pretty horrendously.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: And we have watched the uprising of those women and them trying to claim their basic simple rights. My wife is half Iranian. And she was quite active, she has been quite active.She did -- actually she was one of the first to cut her hair. And I just think what is happening in Iran and also Afghanistan to the women is pretty awful. And we have to do something about it. We can't let it go on. (CROSSTALK) COOPER:  And the Taliban in Afghanistan has stopped women from being able to work for NGOs, which I mean is one --

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Well, there's a deep hypocrisy at work as well there, too.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And the strength and the courage of Iranian people to continue to go out and protest --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Is incredible.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: -- in the wake of hangings and protesters, it is an extraordinary thing.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: They've been amazing.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: In Iran, I don't know if they still do it but, for a while, when they hang people, it is not hanging somebody and letting them drop, which breaks their neck, instantly kills them. It is picking somebody up with a crane so that it is actually suffocation, strangulation.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I know, it is very, very --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Particularly brutal.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Anyway.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: OK. I'm glad you said it because people need to know it.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Well, I think we have to remember these things that need to shift in the New Year.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: The dichotomy that we are here on this joyous occasion enjoying our freedoms.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And to know people elsewhere are cowering in their homes in fear.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I want to thank you so much for coming.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: My pleasure.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You are the perfect after-midnight guest.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: I shall advertise that. Available after midnight.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: He is the perfect after-midnight guest. And I know a thing or two about after-midnight guests.

utterances.speaker: COX
utterances.sentences: So do I.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Brian Cox, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Thank you for the bottle. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, really a pleasure.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Such big fans.Let's bring on Richard Quest really quickly.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: This year falling apart.Richard, you have done this for 25 years.

utterances.speaker: RICHARD QUEST, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I would not miss it for a moment. There is no better place to be than here, excitement, ooh!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It is pretty magical.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Really, it is.There is a -- you sit and you wait and you wait and then it happens. It always surprises me.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: I keep thinking maybe I won't do it this year, maybe I'll do something. But I tell you, I can't think of anywhere else I would rather be. I mean, a house party is a bit lame after --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEfrom around the world, who this is like their bucket-list thing to do, right.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There's a certain specialness and those of us who live in New York take it for granted. This is in our backyard but people travel from around the world to be here where we are.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you both very much.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, guys.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You look so great.Andy, thank you for another year.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Anderson, we made it through.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, we did.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I want to thank CNN for having us.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: For having me, actually.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, and for having me as well.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We will see if it happens again.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, we will. Yes, we will see.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Thanks so much for watching. We wish you the best and, yes, I hope you have a good rest of the night. Thank you for spending the night with us.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You sound a little drunk and you haven't had anything to drink.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It is that pickle juice.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: From four hours ago. COHENcoverage next.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: From New Orleans amazingly.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: From New Orleans. Happy New Year, everybody. Happy 2023.I'm taking this one. We're going out. Yes, we're going out.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We'll see about that.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We're going out.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year's.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I don't hear anything. I think I lost --Hello, hello, hello, everyone. Hello. This is Don Lemon. We are live in New Orleans. We are so happy that you are here. This is the real New Year's Eve from New Orleans, as you can see. I've got (INAUDIBLE) in the French Quarter. I'm joined by some special guests. We want a family-oriented New Year's Eve. So I have my entire family here. Say hi, Mom. KATHERINE CLARK, DON LEMON'S MOTHER:  Hello.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Eighty years young. My entire family.Mannie Fresh is here.

utterances.speaker: MANNIE FRESH, MUSIC PRODUCER
utterances.sentences: How y'all doing.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Grammy-award-winning music producer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Hi, happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I know everyone is wondering, is Don Lemon drinking, is he lit?I will let you be the judge. My mom says I don't need to drink to have this personality.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Never.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is my natural personality. Everybody thinks I'm drunk every year, I'm not. This is my personality.Anyway we have got marching bands. We will do what they do here in New Orleans. We will take you on a parade. We will take you on a ride around New Orleans, show you some people doing really good things for the city. Let's march. Let's have a second line and let's go through. We have on tap so many people, I need notes. My mom and my family. We have The Roots of Music with Derrick Tabb. Derrick, get over here. We have the Hot 8 Brass Band. We have Mannie Fresh, as I introduced to you, the award-winning music producer. The 50th anniversary of hip-hop is coming up tomorrow, as a matter of fact. We will talk about that. Derrick, let's talk about The Roots of Music. You come every year, you have the band, The Roots of Music. These are young people you are helping out. Explain what happens with The Roots of Music.

utterances.speaker: DERRICK TABB, THE ROOTS OF MUSIC
utterances.sentences: The Roots of Music is an after school program dedicated to serving the kids of New Orleans. And we take kids from all around the city, from over 30, 40 schools around the city, bring them to one safe location, where they learn how to play music, New Orleans music.They learn how to be friends before enemies. We teach them skills.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You know what I love about this, I love about New Orleans is the diversity here, right. It is full of beautiful Black people celebrating and you are helping the young youth here, especially young Black children here.Why is that so important to you?

utterances.speaker: TABB
utterances.sentences: Because we find that they need something to do. All kids need something to do to be the best kids you could possibly see. Look at these kids here. They come -- half of these kids never picked up an instrument a day in their life. And now they're producing music. That's what it is all about, teaching them how to survive, how to makeit out of life.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: How long have you been doing this?

utterances.speaker: TABB
utterances.sentences: Fifteen years. This is the 15th year.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And you have success stories?

utterances.speaker: TABB
utterances.sentences: I have a bunch of success stories. I have kids that have been all the way to Berkeley and Spain. Berkeley in music.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Weren't you a runner-up for CNN Heroes?

utterances.speaker: TABB
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Talk to me about that.

utterances.speaker: TABB
utterances.sentences: It was a great experience. In 2009, I was a Top 10 CNN Hero. Man, it was a great experience, to be around others.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I love you, brother. I love what you do. Thank you so much. Don't go anywhere. We have some more people to talk to.Come here. Get over here. This is Howie Kaplan. We are standing outside now of Howlin' Wolf, which is a venue right in New Orleans, right on the corner here. How many people you got here tonight? HOWIE KAPLAN, HOWLIN' WOLF:  Got about 500, 600 people standing on the street tonight.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Howie, you have a very special position here. Tell us what your position is here.

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: So I'm the director of nighttime economy for the City of New Orleans. They call me the night mayor.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: They call you the Night Mayor, not like nightmare, like scary dream but nighttime mayor.How did it happen?

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: It's a lot of hard work. I get to represent the culture bearers (ph) in the City of New Orleans. I get to represent these fantastic musicians and the people that do the work to make New Orleans a special place. And I'm proud I get to be here today and every day, representing my city.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Who are these dolls you have behind you?

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: Look at these ladies.Aren't they gorgeous? They represent a very particular part of our culture. They're part of some of the Mardi Gras people that make it so special in our city. And they do it so beautifully. They do it year around. But we celebrate coming to the Mardi Gras season.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We hear so much about New Orleans, what is happening in New Orleans. As the nighttime mayor of New Orleans, what do you want the world to know about the city?

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: This is the most wonderful place in the world you can come. New Orleans is a world class city. There's no place better in the world to get what you grew up, what I live with every day, the food, the architecture, the music, the culture, the art, everything about where we live and breathe every day is why so many millions of people come here every year. It is time to come back to New Orleans.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Can you explain to people when I first got here, one of the first things you did was hand me this towel?

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: This is a Mardi Gras thing. You sit here and throw your towel and do everything you have got to do. We are a city and we celebrate everything. We celebrate misery, we celebrate loss, we celebrate passion, we celebrate everything. And we do it just like this. New Year's Eve is the best time to do it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It is the symbol of the second line when you do it with the towel.

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Listen, we have a crab boil, we have a crawfish boil, what else?A shrimp boil, everything here. We will talk about the beautiful mural on the side of this building that was in honor of one of the people who started.

utterances.speaker: KAPLAN
utterances.sentences: This beautiful, beautiful mural for a beautiful man that saved many lives and inspired so much passion.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is my gorgeous niece.Hi, gorgeous niece.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Hi, Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: How many drinks have you had?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Several. LEMONSay hi, Cairo (ph). CAIRO (PH), DON LEMON'S GREAT-NEPHEW:  Hi.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Of course, my mom. This is my gorgeous niece, Ashley (ph). Say hi.ASHLEY (PH), DON LEMON'S NIECE:  Hi, everyone.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is my gorgeous niece, Kimberly (ph).KIMBERLY (PH), DON LEMON'S NIECE:  Hi.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is Ashley's (ph) son. Ashley's (ph) son, who is my great- nephew, is a university, LSU University High School football star, being recruited by LSU. Already playing varsity.Say hi.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And that's it for my family. I want to take you guys back to the crowd. Come this way.This is The Roots of Music. This is what Derrick Tapp was talking about, the youth that they are getting here, to take part in learning about music and learning about culture. The kids here don't get the experience of going to Juilliard or don't get the experience of going to big music schools. So what Derrick Tapp does, he takes these kids, he introduces them to music. He takes some of them off the streets. He has success stories. And then they end up being on CNN. Now I want to go over here. These is where we are going to end up. My favorite place. Where? There we go. Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yay!

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is my hometown. I grew up with this. So when you guys think that I'm lit on television or whatever, that's my personality. I grew up in the land of lagniappe (ph), right, "laissez les bons temps rouler."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Hey, Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: "Let the good times roll."How do you guys do this all the time?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All the time. We do this all the time throughout the crawfish season. We just boil them up. Happy New Year. LEMONMaybe almost as good but not quite, is in the Bahamas, in the Caribbean. I want to go to CNN's Stephanie Elam. We have been texting each other. I know you have a special guest that you cannot reveal, you didn't reveal to me. But you are going to reveal now. Is it warm there? Are you having a good time?

utterances.speaker: STEPHANIE ELAM, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: I have been out here breaking a sweat while we were meeting your family, because Deejay Webstar (ph) is over here killing it. I have been dancing nonstop.Look who else is dancing, check it out. Look at this crowd. Look at this crowd, still partying. Well, we are here in Paradise Island in the Bahamas and, Atlantis, now that 2023, about to celebrate its 25th anniversary. They had a big party here tonight. That is still going on. We had (INAUDIBLE), we had (INAUDIBLE) who was here as well (INAUDIBLE). And everyone is having a ball here. We haven't stopped dancing all night, Don. Look, look, people are still getting it. It is so much fun here. On top of it, there's other thing we have better than you guys, the weather. It is like hot as all get out right now. But it feels great. You see, you can tell. It is summertime down here, right. Just a great time had by everybody. Just really good energy, celebrating the New Year with just about 3,000 of our favorite friends.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: All right. I'm live. OK, I'm live. I had no idea I was live. It is really hard to hear here because it's really loud. We have a bunch of people around us, we have the bands going. We're going to talk to these guys.Hi, guys. How are you?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Good to see you again. I can't hear anything, I don't know why.Your name is Evan, right?

utterances.speaker: EVAN TROXELL, GULF COAST CRAWFISH COMPANY
utterances.sentences: I'm Evan with Gulf Coast Crawfish Company here in New Orleans. We are cooking up some crawfish. We heard Don was on the way and we heard he likes them, so he's trying them out.What do you think?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think they're great. The entire commercial break and while Usher was playing, I was sitting here eating crawfish and they're really good.

utterances.speaker: TROXELL
utterances.sentences: Love to hear it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Stand by.Mom, do you want some crawfish?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Do you want me to peel you some.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I know how to peel them.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Are you enjoying this?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Here is what you guys should know. You guys think this is a big deal. Basically this is like every weekend in Louisiana, especially during football season. We either fry fish, we do a crab or crawfish boil or a fish fry and there's bands everywhere.

utterances.speaker: TROXELL
utterances.sentences: We do this every weekend. We are just always having a party, having a good time, you know. That's how we enjoy our time here.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So Mom, during the fall, like we would do this. We went to Southern University which is an HBCU, Southern University football games, it was like this.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We had the bands playing, we had The Battle of Bands. We'd tailgate in the parking lot. We would have crawfish or shrimp and we would drink.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Boiled corn and potatoes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And we would have a good time. CLARK

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Let me tell you a story about resilience and about life and about love. My mom called me on Christmas Eve and said, this is really sad, her boyfriend died.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She found her boyfriend unresponsive, right.And I told her, I said, well, Mom, I want you to come host New Year's Eve with me to talk about life and love.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And to celebrate life.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And you are here celebrating because life is what?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It's short, baby.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And it is for the living.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It is for the living and you told me, we all have to leave here one day.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. So anyway, I'm celebrating with my mom, who has dealt with some tragedy. But she taught me how to live, how to be resilient. She gave me the best advice ever that I have ever had in the world when I worry about things.She said 90 percent of the S-H-I-you-know-what that I worried about ...

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: What happens?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: -- never came to fruition.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's why -- how I live my life, not worrying about anything. So when you guys see me all gregarious on New Year's Eve and you think I'm lit, I'm having a good time.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: We're only here for so long and enjoy it while you're here.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She is the best. She is the best.So listen, Mom, turn around because we want to see you on camera. So Mom, how long have you been on this Earth?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Eighty years.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I gave her a surprise 80th birthday party for her birthday in October.And everyone said, are you going to give an 80-year-old a surprise party?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And what happened?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It was a big surprise.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So my mom doesn't go anywhere without her own glam squad.I said, Mom, CNN is going to hire a glam squad for you. She said, that's OK, I'm bringing my own glam squad. Come here, Beverly (ph). How long have you been doing my mom's hair? BEVERLY (PH), KATHERINE CLARK'S HAIRDRESSER:  Over 30 years.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thirty years?BEVERLY (PH):  Over 30 years.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So she takes her glam squad everywhere.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: And she comes to my house and does my hair.BEVERLY (PH):  Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Thirty years.What is this character like, Beverly (ph)? BEVERLY (PH):  Oh, my God. No words can explain how spoiled she is. (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Does it make you understand why I am the way I am?BEVERLY (PH):  It does.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Because? BEVERLY (PH)(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm not spoiled.BEVERLY (PH):  She spoiled you.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Did you spoil me?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Mom, you look really cute tonight.What happened?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I'm always cute.(LAUGHTER) BEVERLY (PH):  Always.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Excuse me?(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It took something to come down here though, it really did.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It has kind of helped me out, it really has.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.What do you say to the folks at home? You and I talked about, you know, Anderson is doing this series on grief and how to be resilient.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And has that helped you?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: By you talking and encouraging me to come here it has really helped. But of course, I have flashes of times we had together. It goes and comes. Sometimes I'm up, sometimes I'm down.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So my mom and I have dealt with a lot over the last couple of years. My sister passed.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And we dealt with that. And then her boyfriend passed and we dealt with that.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But guess what?You got to keep moving, right? No matter what happens.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I'm still alive.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.My mom knows every single thing about me.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Everything. No secrets.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: You will call me and ask me anything.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I'm like, you know what you're supposed to do better than I do.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: One of the best times that we've ever had -- I think you guys saw it play out here on CNN -- there's a drone going up.You see the drone right there? Playing out on CNN is when you and I went to Ghana. Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We traced our roots.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Was that beautiful?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: That was beautiful. I'll never forget that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I remember we were sitting by the sea. My mom said to me, which was really moving, she said, you have -- I'm the mom and I'm supposed to show you things.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Right. But you're showing me things now, I'm learning from you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: What was that like?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: It was amazing.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You think you're grown and you know everything.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I tell you guys, you try to rule me. I'm like, I've been here 80 years.And you think you know more than I do? Never.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So Mom, I love you.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: I love you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm glad you're co-anchoring with me.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, I was like, what am I supposed to say?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You're supposed to say whatever you want to say --

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: No, I can't say whatever I want to say.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I know you want to say a lot. You have a lot to say to a lot of people who -- I might get fired.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I love you.Weekend Excursion is performing in New York City and we love them, let's listen to them now. Thanks, Mom, I love you.

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Do you know the words to "Auld Lang Syne"?

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: Hell, no.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Hell, no. Mannie Fresh.Can you talk to me about these two? As we get ready for New Year's Eve to kick in here, the 50th anniversary of hip-hop is when?

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: Right now, tomorrow. We're celebrating the 50th anniversary of hip-hop.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: The 50th anniversary of hip-hop, plan to be a part of it.Mannie Fresh, you helped start the hip-hop movement.

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir, here in New Orleans. Hey, it's your boy, man, it's Fresh.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's your boy, man, Fresh. Mannie Fresh is a big deal, a Grammy Award-winning artist, right?

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: What is so special about New Orleans?

utterances.speaker: FRESH
utterances.sentences: I mean, the people. The people. There's no place like New Orleans. Ain't no party like a New Orleans party, because the New Orleans party don't end.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Give us a hit before we go. Give us something before we go into the New Year here, Mannie. Give us a little something-something.
